Class MXAdapter

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.eclipse.mxadapter.MXAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDeploymentAdapter
public class MXAdapter
extends Object
implements IDeploymentAdapter

Adapter to the MX database.

$Id: MXAdapter.java 791 2010-05-14 17:51:56Z tim.moxter $

PATTERN_PACKAGE

private static final Pattern PATTERN_PACKAGE
Regular expression for the package line. The package name must be extracted to get the real name of the JPO used within MX.

imageMap

private final Map<String,Map<String,org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor>> imageMap
Map used to hold the images for MxUpdate files. The first key is the file extension, the second key the file prefix.

See Also:
initImageDescriptors(), getImageDescriptor(IFile)

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Checks if the adapter is already connected to the database.

Specified by:
isConnected in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Returns:
true if the connector is not null (means adapter is already connected); otherwise false
See Also:
connector

connect

public void connect()
             throws Exception
Connects to the MX database.

Specified by:
connect in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Throws:
Exception - if connect failed
See Also:
#connected, #mxContext, checkVersions()

checkVersions

protected void checkVersions()
Checks that the version of the MxUpdate Eclipse Plug-In and the version of the MxUpdate Update Deployment Tool have the same major and minor number within their versions. If not equal the plug-in automatically disconnects from MX.

See Also:
disconnect(), getPlugInVersion(), connect()

getPlugInVersion

protected String getPlugInVersion()
                           throws IOException
Returns for this plug-in the version stored within manifest file.

Returns:
found plug-in version within manifest file
Throws:
IOException - if the manifest file could not found or not opened
See Also:
MANIFEST_FILE

disconnect

public boolean disconnect()
                   throws Exception
Disconnect from the MX database.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Returns:
true if already disconnected or disconnect from MX database was successfully; otherwise false is returned
Throws:
Exception - if disconnect failed
See Also:
#connected, #mxContext

update

public void update(List<org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile> _files,
                   boolean _compile)
            throws Exception
Updates given MX update files in the MX database. If #PREF_UPDATE_FILE_CONTENT is set, also the file content is transfered within the update (e.g. if an update on another server is done).

Specified by:
update in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_files - MxUpdate file which must be updated
_compile - if true all JPOs are compiled; if false no JPOs are compiled, only an update is done
Throws:
Exception - if update failed (or included connect)
See Also:
#execMql(CharSequence)

getTypeDefRoot

public ITypeDefRoot getTypeDefRoot()
                            throws Exception
Evaluates the type tree hierarchy and returns the root. The type definition root is evaluated directly in MX and only converted in the required format.

Specified by:
getTypeDefRoot in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Returns:
root type tree (or null if it could not evaluated)
Throws:
Exception - if execute failed

appendSubNode

protected void appendSubNode(ITypeDefRoot _node,
                             Map<?,?> _treeNode,
                             Map<?,?> _treeMap)
Appends to the _node all required / defined sub nodes.

Parameters:
_node - node where sub nodes must be appended
_treeNode - current tree node which must be appended
_treeMap - map with all tree definitions from MX

search

public List<ISearchItem> search(Set<String> _typeDefList,
                                String _match)
Searches for configuration items within MX.

Specified by:
search in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_typeDefList - list with searched type definitions
_match - string for the names with must match
Returns:
found search items

export

public IExportItem export(org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile _file)
                   throws Exception
Extract the TCL update code for given _file from MX.

Specified by:
export in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_file - name of the update file for which the TCL update code within MX must be extracted
Returns:
configuration item update code for given _file
Throws:
Exception - if export failed

extractMxName

protected String extractMxName(org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile _file)
                        throws org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException,
                               IOException
If a file is a JPO (checked by calling the extraxtMxName method from super class), the package is extracted from file and returned together with the extracted MxName from the file.

Parameters:
_file - file for which the MX name is searched
Returns:
MX name or null if the file is not an update file for current type definition
Throws:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException - if file content incl. character set could not be fetched
IOException - if file could not be read
See Also:
PATTERN_PACKAGE

export

public IExportItem export(String _typeDef,
                          String _item)
Exports defined _item with depending _typeDef.

Specified by:
export in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_typeDef - type definition
_item - MX name to export
Returns:
list of exported files

Returns for given _file related image descriptor.

Specified by:
getImageDescriptor in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_file - file for which the image descriptor is searched
Returns:
found image descriptor; otherwise null
See Also:

getImageDescriptor

public org.eclipse.jface.resource.ImageDescriptor getImageDescriptor(String _typeDef)
Returns for given type definition _typeDef related image descriptor.

Specified by:
getImageDescriptor in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_typeDef - type definition for which the image descriptor is searched
Returns:
found image descriptor; otherwise null
See Also:
typeDef2Image

execute

public String execute(CharSequence _command)
               throws Exception
Executes given _command within the console. To do this the plug-in method "Execute" is called on the server.

Specified by:
execute in interface IDeploymentAdapter
Parameters:
_command - MQL command to execute
Returns:
result of the MQL execution
Throws:
Exception - if MQL execution fails or a connect failed
See Also:
connect()

executeEncoded

protected Map<?,?> executeEncoded(String[] _parameters,
                                  String _method,
                                  Object[] _arguments)
                           throws Exception
Calls given _method in of the MxUpdate eclipse plug-in dispatcher. The MX context #mxContext is connected to the database if not already done.

Parameters:
_parameters - parameters
_method - method of the called _jpo
_arguments - list of all parameters for the _jpo which are automatically encoded encoded
Returns:
returned value from the called _jpo
Throws:
Exception - if the parameter could not be encoded, or if the called _jpo throws an exception, or if the class which is decoded from the returned string value could not be found
See Also:
#mxContext, connect()
